facts.fact: The energy released by the sun in just one second is equivalent to the energy that would be produced by detonating a billion atomic bombs.
A bolt of lightning carries enough energy to power a 100-watt light bulb for more than three months.
The tallest wind turbine in the world is located in Germany and stands 246 meters (807 feet) tall. That's taller than the Great Pyramid of Giza!
The first hydroelectric power plant in the United States began operation in Wisconsin in 1882.
The average microwave oven uses more energy in one hour than a refrigerator does in an entire day.
A gallon of gasoline contains about 31,000 calories of energy.
The world's largest solar power plant is located in the Mojave Desert in California and covers more than 5 square miles.
In 2019, wind power generated more electricity than hydroelectric power for the first time ever in the United States.
The amount of energy in the world's oceans could power the world for millions of years if it could be harnessed effectively.
